newsitem.title: USA: Duriron sees Q1 shr $0.41 to $0.48.
newsitem.headline: Duriron sees Q1 shr $0.41 to $0.48.

text.p: Duriron Co Inc said on Friday that it expects first quarter earnings per share of $0.41 to $0.48.

"We expect margins and earnings for the first quarter of 1997 to be between levels seen during the first two quarters of 1996," chairman, president and chief executive William Jordan said in a statement.
The company said its first quarter results would be a record for the period, but First Call's consensus estimate of analysts' earnings expectations for the first quarter are $0.52 a share.

Duriron reported earnings per share of $0.41 in last year's first quarter on sales of $149.2 million. In last year's second quarter, the company's operating earnings per share before a charge totaled $0.48 on sales of $151.1 million.
Shipments for the period will be below expectations and two of its orders will not be shipped until the second quarter, instead of the first, the company said.
Regarding the company's outlook for the year, Duriron said it is confident to achieve its annual goals based on market activity and its order backlog.
The company said its operating pressure will be on increasing shipping performance and continuing to improve margins.
